title: EyeQue VisionCheck
description:
Test your vision at home with the VisionCheck app and device! 

**Requires the EyeQue VisionCheck device to take vision tests.**

*Don’t have one? Order from EyeQue or Amazon today!*

Our second-generation CES-award winning vision test, VisionCheck, is powered by MIT-patented technology to help you learn about your refractive error i.e. your nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism.

You can use the EyeQue VisionCheck app if you:

- Have a single vision prescription between +8.00 and -10.00

- Have a cylinder between 0 and -5.00

- Are ages 25 and older

- Want to track your vision

You should not use the EyeQue VisionCheck app if you:

- Have light sensitivity

- Are colorblind or have difficulty differentiating between red and green

- Require a prism measurement

- Have difficulty holding up a smartphone while navigating the smartphone screen

- Have a medical condition that affects your eyes or eyesight, including but not limited to glaucoma, age-related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, or cataracts. 

The VisionCheck uses MIT-patented Inverse Shack-Hartmann technology, which utilizes optical lenses combined with your smartphone’s pixel movement, to measure where the light focuses on the back of your retina. This means that to take a vision test, you’ll attach the VisionCheck to your phone, which will act a light source during the test, then take multiple measurements at different angles by merging a red and a green line into a solid yellow line.

*This is a self-administered vision test and results may vary. Our test performance feedback instantly lets you know how well you tested and provides resources to improve test performance.*

We take your privacy very seriously and do not share your information with 3rd parties.
